climbs.name: Vampaya
climbs.fa: FA, Bolted, Prep by Alan Collins

content.description: Starts off the right side of a large rock on the ground. Pull onto a dike and go straight up the bolt line above. A small traverse down low can be trivial, but the true crux come at the last 3 bolts. Get ready for some intense vertical climbing to a powerful overhang.
content.protection: No fixed draws but steel carabiners are fixed at anchors
content.location: Start off the right side of a large rock and follow the bolt line that goes up instead of an early traverse. Climbs into a shallow overhanging dihedral at the end

climbs.name: True Democracy
climbs.fa: FA, Bolted, by Alan Collins, Prepped by Chris Hatzai

content.description: Start a few feet left of a small boulder and work into a crack below the first bolt. A methodical 5.11 vertical section continues until the final 2 bolts, where the power sapping overhanging climbing begins. Although its a short crux, it sure packs a pump!
content.protection: 8 bolts with fixed carabiners on anchor. 1 steel draw fixed at the crux
content.location: Starts right of a small boulder. Climbs into a crack below the first bolt.

climbs.name: Raggamuffin
climbs.fa: FA Michelle Priatt, John Collins, and Alan Collins Bolt/prep by Alan Collins and Michelle Priatt

content.description: Climb through the some of the most solid rock on the wall almost the entire way. Start off the ground on the crux of the route, then finesse your way into the cave on vertical crimps.
content.protection: Fully bolted. Steel carabiners at the anchors
content.location: Climbs into the left side of the cave half way thought the route. Find the start of those bolts

content.description: Fun line of jugs, underlings and pinches with a crux at two-thirds height. The position on this wall is among the loftiest (and sunniest) at Smith.
content.location: Rightmost route on this packed wall, follows a path between two caves

climbs.name: Natty Congo
climbs.fa: FA Quentin Roberts and Alan Collins, Bolt/ Prep by Alan Collins and Quentin Roberts

content.description: Climbs a nearly vertical face to a slight overhang. Pulling through the overhang and establishing in the vert wall above is the crux, although a power sapping redpoint crux guards the anchors above a dihedral.
content.protection: Fully bolted. No hung draws but anchors have steel carabiners
content.location: Just left of the cave. Doest climb into the cave. Ends in a right facing corner.

climbs.name: Livity
climbs.fa: FA, Alan Collins, Kevin Piarulli, and Neil Ellison. Prep and Bolted by Alan Collins

content.description: A good warmup for the harder routes on the wall or for aspiring 5.11 climbers. With a bolt every body length, this climb isn't very mentally committing like most the 5.11 at smith. There is a few thought provoking cruxes that keep a pump going for most of the route. Climb a few feet above the last bolt to get to the chains on insecure climbing climbing.
content.protection: Bolts with steel carabiner on anchors
content.location: Most left route on the wall.

climbs.name: The Last Straw
climbs.fa: FA, Bolted and Prep Alan Collins and Kevin Piarulli

content.description: A one bolt variation that bumps the grade up a couple notches. Climb the first 7 bolts of Beginners Luck and go left after clipping the 7th. Climb up to the 8th bolt and finish back on Beginner Luck.
content.protection: 10 bolts with fixed carabiners on the anchors.
content.location: Start off Beginners luck and go left at the 7th bolt. Finish on Beginners Luck

climbs.name: Gideon
climbs.fa: FA Michelle Priatt, Bolted and prep by Alan Collins

content.description:
Start off a rock platform and travers a dike up and left for 2 bolts. Climb through some featured rock to a small overhang. A vert wall above the overhang will keep you on your toes. Don't get sucked out to the right bolt line, a jug between the routes makes it easy to do if you don't pay attention. The routes are close but the climbing is independent.

 (A redtag may still be on this route for the linkup that moves onto the route left of the roof. Please stay off the linkup if the redtag isn't moved, i can't remember if i moved it yet. I will delete this when I move it. Enjoy the route in the meanwhile)
content.protection: Fully bolted. Fixed steel carabiners at anchors
content.location: Start off the right side of a large rock feature. Traverse a system of underclings on a dike for two bolts.

climbs.name: Beginners Luck
climbs.fa: FA, Bolted and Prepped by Evan Simms

content.description: This route will throw some qualified climbers for a loop. As typical for smith, do a crux move getting off the ground to the first bolt and enjoy some quality rock and thoughtful movement. Above the 4th bolt, climb into a big cave. Finding a way out of the cave can be tricky, but alt lest it is well protected. At the 7th bolt, veer to the right and skip the 5.11 bulge.
content.protection: Fixed anchor with steel carabiner. no fixed draws 10 bolts

content.description: A dozen or so sport climbs on good quality rock, ranging from 5.10+ to 5.13-, coat this wall. Most of the routes are about 60ft tall and all offer some unique movement. The wall is generally vertical techy climbing with some steeper parts towards the top. For those who want to beat the crowds on the popular 5.12's but don't want to  sacrifice quality, this wall is perfect. Also a great spot for climbers going to the Maiden Oregon Wall and Colosseum to warm up at.
